abstract: Since WikiLeaks threatened to “take down” a major American bank, officials at Bank of America have been hunting for any sign that its systems have been compromised.
snippet: Since WikiLeaks threatened to “take down” a major American bank, officials at Bank of America have been hunting for any sign that its systems have been compromised.
lead_paragraph: By the time the conference call ended, it was nearly midnight at Bank of America’s headquarters in Charlotte, N.C., but the bank’s counterespionage work was only just beginning, Nelson D. Schwartz reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Facing WikiLeaks Threat, Bank Plays Defense
